page.title: 05Northdown Farm
page.content: Today,July 15th,we went to{Northdown {Farm,Sutton Poyntz.}The farm has been owned by the Saunders Family since 1907,though it has been there since Roman Times.There are 330 acres and all but the 25 acres used for Barley are for grazing cattle. The farm has 90 cows and 83 were in milking.They were mostly Friesians but some were Guernseys.These give less milk but it is richer.The cows which give the most milk eat the most food. The cows eat cattle cake,which is made from little pellets.The pellets are fed to the cows as they are being milked in the {abreast parlour.}(You can have rotary or herringbone parlours)The cows give about 1042 litres a day.Each cow gives about 10-11 litres a day.In Summer the cows eat grass.In Winter they eat silage and hay instead of grass.
